questions.question: In general, which drink contains more alcohol than the other two?
When entering high-speed roadways, you should do the following except:
choices: Turn your head to look to the side before changing lanes
Enter at or near the speed of traffic

questions.question: A shared center turn lane must be used for:
When driving at night, which of the following is a requirement?
choices: Driving 10 mph below the posted speed limit
Making sure you can stop within the distance lighted by your headlights
Using your parking lights if it rains

questions.question: When asked by an officer at a traffic stop, a driver must:
choices: Provide information about their occupation and income
Provide an explanation as to why they are driving on the roadway

questions.question: What is true about signaling before suddenly reducing speed?
choices: Only the vehicle's signal lights may be used
It is not necessary to signal when you reduce speed

questions.question: The best way to increase visibility when backing up is to:
choices: Turn your head and look out the rear window

questions.question: After driving through deep water, you should:
You are entering a work zone. There is a temporary speed limit displayed. You must
choices: Obey the limit only when workers are present
Obey the limit except at night

questions.question: If you are traveling in lane B (beneath a steady yellow X), you must:
choices: Change lane in a safe manner

questions.question: When traveling at 30 mph on dry pavement, your approximate stopping distance is:
What is generally true about large trucks?
choices: They have longer stopping distances than most cars
They have smaller blind spots than most cars
They need less room to maneuver

questions.question: A person who is speeding, runs a red light, and fails to stop at the command of a police officer can be convicted of: of a police officer may be convicted of:
When should you avoid using your high-beam headlights?
choices: On unfamiliar roads with no oncoming traffic

questions.question: When parking parallel to a curb, you should NOT park:
choices: More than 12 inches from the curb
More than six inches from the curb
More than ten inches from the curb

questions.question: A flashing red traffic light tells you to:
choices: Slow down before entering the intersection
Stop and wait for a green light

questions.question: Many car/bicycle accidents occur because:
choices: The motorist does not see the bicyclist

questions.question: Following closely behind another vehicle:
choices: Is the cause of most rear-end accidents

questions.question: What is the standard color of a general warning sign like this?
When approached from behind by an emergency vehicle with activated lights and sirens, you must:
choices: Proceed at normal speed, the emergency vehicle will move over to pass
Drive to the right edge of the road and stop
Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down

questions.question: When you approach this sign, you should be especially aware of:
What is the leading cause of car skids?
choices: Drivers driving too fast for road conditions

questions.question: If your vehicle stalls in the path of an oncoming train, you should get away from the tracks and move in what direction?
choices: In the direction you were traveling
In the same direction as the train is traveling

questions.question: What should you do if you are involved in a traffic crash, and someone is injured?
choices: Help the person from the car and make the person lie down
Give the person something to drink

questions.question: To better prepare for the constant decisions necessary for safe, defensive driving, you must:
choices: Know what is happening around your vehicle
Drive at least 10 mph below the posted speed limit

questions.question: This is:
A driver turns at an intersection without traffic lights, and a pedestrian is crossing. Who must yield?
You may be denied a Delaware driver's license for the following:
choices: Possession of a foreign driver's license
Addiction to the use of narcotic drugs

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
What does this lane's pavement marking (diamond symbol) tell you?
choices: It is a lane for slow moving traffic

questions.question: To prepare for hazards on the road, you should:
choices: Continually scan the entire road and roadsides
Drive with your left foot resting lightly on the brake pedal
Always keep your eyes focused straight ahead

questions.question: What is the background color on a motorist service sign like this?
What should you do if you are involved in a traffic crash, and someone is injured with severe bleeding?
choices: Keep the head as high as possible
Apply direct pressure to the wound
Give the person plenty to drink

questions.question: Anti-lock brakes are most effective when you:
What does a solid yellow line on a two-lane road indicate?
At night, you should drive with your headlights on the high beam:
choices: On unfamiliar roads with no oncoming traffic
In well-lit areas and business districts.

questions.question: What is a suitable restraint system for a seven-year-old child who weighs less than 65 pounds?
Which is the most critical vehicle control to use during a skid?
Once you have entered a roundabout:
choices: Be prepared to give entering vehicles the right-of-way
Do not stop, except to avoid a collision
Flash your turn signal continuously through the roundabout

questions.question: What parts of a road might hold frost and ice while the rest is dry?
When approaching a stationary emergency vehicle with flashing lights on a multi-lane highway, you must:
choices: Stay in your lane and keep your speed
Move over if it is safe to do so
Drive to the right-hand side and stop

questions.question: If you cancel your liability insurance for any reason, you must first:
choices: Surrender your valid license plate to the DMV

questions.question: You should never attempt to overtake a bicyclist:
choices: Just before making a right turn

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
A green arrow on a traffic light means
choices: You may not turn in that direction
You can only turn in that direction after a complete stop
You must turn in that direction

questions.question: If red lights are flashing and gates are closing at a railroad crossing, you should:
choices: Stop and remain stopped until gates open and lights stop flashing
Speed up and pass the crossing before the gates close
Stop and wait until the gates close, then drive carefully around the gates

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
When driving in a fog, you should:
What does HOV stand for?
What does this sign mean?
choices: You must give the right-of-way to pedestrians and vehicles
All approaching traffic to this intersection must stop

questions.question: Which statement about tires is false?
choices: Tire pressure should be checked when tires are cold
The only contact your vehicle has with the road is through the tires
Low tire pressure improves fuel economy

questions.question: This is an example of:
You must never park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?
You must stop before railroad tracks:
choices: Any time a train may be approaching
Even when the tracks are out-of-service
If your vehicle has three or more axles

questions.question: What shape is a road sign that tells you there is a school crossing ahead?
The eight-sided shape is used for which road signs?
What is true about tailgating (following another vehicle too closely)?
choices: It gives you enough time to stop or avoid a hazard
It makes it easier to see signs of problems ahead
It is a common cause of rear-end crashes

questions.question: A white cloth tied to a radio antenna or a door handle indicates:
What does this road sign mean?
When driving at night on well-lighted streets, you should use:
What should you do if you see smoke from under your vehicle's hood?
choices: Turn off the engine and steer straight ahead
Drive off the road clear of traffic and stop

questions.question: You have a green light, and vehicles are blocking your way into the intersection. What should you do?
If the pavement is wet as you approach this sign, it is dangerous to:
When taking drugs that are likely to affect your driving, you should:
If you are angry or upset with another driver, you should:
choices: Out-maneuver and cut off the other driver

questions.question: Shared Lane Markings (Sharrows) indicate that bicyclists:
choices: Must ride close to the right-hand edge
May take the whole travel lane

questions.question: If you are in a roundabout when an emergency vehicle with flashing lights approaches from behind, you should:
choices: Move to the right in the roundabout and stop
Proceed through the roundabout and continue driving
Proceed through the roundabout before stopping

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a highway, you must always:
choices: Decrease your following distance to any car ahead
Slow down to watch the ongoing work

questions.question: Which drivers are more likely to have their driving skills affected by alcohol?
choices: Drivers with a commercial driver license

questions.question: It is a good idea to give a sharp blast on your horn:
choices: When a child is about to run into the street
When passing a horse-drawn vehicle or horseback rider
When you want someone to drive faster

questions.question: Parking lights on your car must be:
choices: White or amber to the front, red to the rear
White or amber in all directions
Red to the front and amber to the rear

questions.question: If a yellow center line is solid on your side of the road, it means:
When being stopped by a police vehicle, you should:
choices: Continue driving until you reach an exit

questions.question: What is true about Anti-Lock Brakes (ABS)?
choices: ABS is designed to shorten your stopping distance
ABS helps you avoid skidding while braking
You must remove your foot when the brake pedal starts pulsating

questions.question: You are driving on a narrow residential street. There are oncoming vehicles on your left and parked vehicles on your right. You should steer:
choices: Closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles
A middle course between oncoming and parked vehicles
Closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles

questions.question: This is the shape and background color of:
You are about to make a left turn. Before turning, signal continuously for at least:
If you run off the pavement, you should:
choices: Drive directly back onto the pavement
Use your gas pedal to keep speed

questions.question: When driving near a pedestrian who is carrying a white cane or using a guide dog, you should:
choices: Slow down and be prepared to stop

questions.question: How much alcohol gets into your blood depends primarily on the following:
choices: The kind of alcoholic beverage you drink
How well you can hold your liquor

questions.question: You are following a large vehicle. It approaches an intersection and signals left but moves out to the right. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Assume the signal is wrong and it is really turning right
Pass quickly as it starts to slow down
Stay well back and give it room

questions.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curbs, your front wheels should be:
choices: Turned to the right (away from the travel lane)
Parallel with the edge of the street
Turned to the left (toward the travel lane)
